ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I wish there was a way to download all the readings. Also I thought the IDs in the test were silly.
On field trips, they were canceled due to snow but would have been an excellent addition to the course.But they were planned! Too much snow to study fire. Yeats was right.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: I liked the lectures and the presentations
Great balance between science and policy, lots of real-world tie-ins.
The structure of the course allowed students to more thoroughly investigate topics of interest. Also, it provided the needed fundamentals of the subject matter.
Ann's willingness to cover material of interest to the students and her guidance.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The midterm should just be essay questions
I'd have loved to have field trips!

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: No lab

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: An elective for me but works well with my career interests
I think this subject is a necessity to the field of forestry. Whether or not you intend to work in fire prone areas, the fundamentals can be applied across many differing aspects of forestry.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Personal/professional interest
Interested in the Forest Service
Because it is interesting. And, contrary to Smokey's opinion, forest fires rule.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: They exceeded my expectations
Yes particularly science part.

Yes, I was seeking foundational skills and concepts relating to forests and fires. I think the course did a great job of supplying this. Further, it allowed me the independence to investigate deeper into aspects of interest.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: All students interested in forest management should take this course.
Take it, hope it's a dry spring

This course is geared to a specific interest group, but does quite well at explaining it! If you ever think you could work for an organization that fights fire, you absolutely must take this course. It will help you make better management decisions (and keep you informed in conversations with fire people!)
Do the readings and start the projects early.
